data.title: Tooltips
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Win7/Godot 2.0.3

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
Tooltips on buttons blink on some machines.  When tested with another app (MS word) tooltips that app's tooltips did not blink.

**Steps to reproduce:**
Create a button with a tooltip
run
mouse over the button
tooltip regularly blinks on and off 

**Link to minimal example project** (optional but very welcome):

---

Not sure if this is button related or all tooltips. However playing around with this on Win10 I see that the tooltip cuts off if the mouse gets any movement at all, even if it stays over the button. IMO the tool tip should only go off if the mouse moves off the button.

data.title: Scenetree Nodes drag and drop visual representation
data.body:
Currently when selecting many nodes in the scene tree and dragging them creates a list with all selected items which can result in a very long list that is displayed at the cursor position which is imho not needed. You probably read not more than the first 5 items, if even. Why not display the first few items and then fade them out.
Here is a mockup of how it could look like. 
![dnd](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6723918/15317672/c7a19710-1c22-11e6-883b-594f185fe1af.jpg)

data.title: Bug. set_pos not called in body_enter
data.body:
Windows 10. GoDot 2.0.3 stability

Bug. Why `set_pos()` for current node don't work on `body_enter()` signal. Other methods are called from that signal.

Ex:
`func body_enter(body):`
    `self.set_pos(Vector2(100,100)) # doesn't work`
    `body.set_pos(Vector2(100,100)) # normal`

data.title: Grouping nodes in Editor
data.body:
How group node in Editor without scripting?
This is possible?

data.title: AnimationPlayer changes its frame milliseconds before looping
data.body:
This is on Godot_v2.0.3_stable_win64.exe
- Add a Normal Node Sprite
- Set the texture to your spritesheet
- Set the vFrames and hFrames respectively
- Keyframe an animation using the AnimationPlayer with `steps` set to `0`, and then set it to `continuous`.
- Set the len(s) to: 0.8
- Now on the first keyframe, set the  `Frame` 0.
- Now on the last animation keyframe set the `Frame` to 19 (or your total amount of frames -1)

Now here is where the bug is:

Look at where the timeline is at, it's **barely** at the end, and it's showing the `Frame` 19. Which is correct: **(This is the last frame it should be on before looping)**
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10387670/15309133/d6d3951a-1b98-11e6-81c2-3f138e88758c.png)

Now, move the timeline cursor over just a bit (you might need to click on the image to zoom in) and look what happens:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10387670/15309150/024ff418-1b99-11e6-9f02-dbb8b5226b34.png)

It goes to the last frame right at the last millisecond before looping. Which causing distortion (barely noticeable) when animating. You can change the steps value to 0.0001 to fix this, but the distortion still happens.

data.title: ShaderGraph shader turns black after save

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
ShaderGraph shader display as expected until you save the scene, then they go black.

**Steps to reproduce:**

- create a new shader material for material override
- create a new shaderGraph shader
- add a texture uniform, connect uv and connect rgb to diffuse, you should see your texture

data.title: Parent does not reflect changes in children
data.body:
**Godot Version:** 
![](https://i.imgur.com/BNC2WNQ.png)

Currently when you make changes to the children of Panel Container (**NB**: This also applies to other nodes that make changes to children, but for sake of this post I will use PanelContainer as an example) the parent does not adjust unless I make any changes inside it after making changes in a child.

**Scene Tree:**
![](https://i.imgur.com/3d7p2Vs.png)

**Before making changes to child**
![](https://i.imgur.com/CkmrTOa.png)

**After making changes to child**
![](https://i.imgur.com/brhkRZV.png)

As you can see, the parent do not wrap the children as it is set to do.
![](https://i.imgur.com/KirLrNa.png)

However if I just click inside one of the parents' margin, and press enter;
![](https://i.imgur.com/15dJq8x.png)

It changes to the way it _should_ have been after making these changes to child.
![](https://i.imgur.com/wqfZiur.png)

While this is not anything "serious", it would be nice to have it looked at - and adjusted so that It do as expected :)

data.title: set_drag_preview - Starting without actually dragging
data.body:
Hey guys, I have the following code inside `func _ready()`:
My scene is just a basic scene with a button.

```
var MyButton = get_node("Button")
var cpb = ColorPickerButton.new()
cpb.set_size(Vector2(150, 150))
MyButton.set_drag_preview(cpb)
```

After calling set_drag_preview and starting up my app I receive:

https://i.gyazo.com/8dfa0f45fe56b8b986a3f8d032cbfd25.gif

It seems like the drag event starts automatically but I am actually not dragging my button or even holding down my mouse to move.. Not sure if this is intended

Edit: Also, it could be any item, not just a ColorPicker

data.title: StreamPeerTCP.is_connected() always return true
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Official 2.0.3.stable win64, running under Windows 8.1

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):

Once `StreamPeerTCP.connect()` is called, `StreamPeerTCP.is_connected()` will always return true even if there is no server running at the other side.

This behavior makes `.is_connected()` useless to know if it is actually connected to a server.

**Steps to reproduce:**
Into the example below, we want to try to connect to the server every 3 seconds.
But it does not work because client.is_connected() return true as soon as client.connect() is called, this even if there is no server running.

**Link to minimal example project** (optional but very welcome):

```
extends Control

const PORT = 64335
const HOST = "127.0.0.1"
var client = StreamPeerTCP.new()
var server_replied = false

const TIMEOUT = 3

var timeout_counter = 0
var connect_attemps_counter = 0

func _ready():
    set_process(true)
    pass

func _process(delta):
    if not client.is_connected() :
        if timeout_counter == 0 :
            connect_attemps_counter += 1
            print("Connecting to ",HOST,":",PORT," (",connect_attemps_counter,")")
            client.connect(HOST,PORT)
        else:
            timeout_counter += delta
            if timeout_counter >= TIMEOUT :
                timeout_counter = 0 # we would like to try to connect again
    elif client.is_connected() and client.get_available_bytes()>0 :
        var r = client.get_var()
        server_replied = true
        print("Connected")
    pass

```

data.title: Editor crashes when clicking on empty area in 2D scene (GCC 6)
data.body:
Hi!

**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Arch Linux, GCC 6.1.1, x86-64 build, Godot 2.0.3

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
Editor crashes when clicking on empty area in 2D scene.

**Steps to reproduce:**
- compile Godot "target=release_debug" using GCC 6 (any optimization level other than -O0),
- run the editor, 
- switch to 2D scene, 
- add root Node,
- click on empty area.

Current behavior: crash
Expected behavior: doesn't crash

I've noticed that Godot calls a method `cast_to()` when the pointer points to `0x0`. This method doesn't use member variables, but anyway it crashes on GCC 6. I think calling a method when pointer is `0x0` especially for casting from `this` is not a good idea, because the behavior is undefined - in most cases it works properly, but - as You can see - not always (e.g. GCC 6 or probably other special cases).

Godot crashes somewhere inside C++ library `__cxxabiv1::__dynamic_cast` (the `rdi` register - which is first function argument treated as a pointer - is 0x0, so it must crash):

``` assembly
        50 [1]  in /build/gcc-multilib/src/gcc/libstdc++-v3/libsupc++/dyncast.cc
0x7f42c08e89d0  <+0x0020>        48 8b 07                    mov    rax,QWORD PTR [rdi]
```

When compiling with `-O0` optimization the it works fine - it doesn't call the `__cxxabiv1::__dynamic_cast` function and it returns `NULL` immediately. The `__cxxabiv1::__dynamic_cast` function mustn't be called with `NULL` argument.
It is difficult to debug it on `-Og` level due to optimizations (can't debug on `-O0`, because it works properly), but when I reading the assembly code, it looks for me like GCC 6 does an optimization: it doesn't check the `this` argument before calling the `dynamic_cast`, because it expects that `this` will never be `NULL`.

This patch fixes the issue:

``` diff
diff --git a/tools/editor/plugins/canvas_item_editor_plugin.cpp b/tools/editor/plugins/canvas_item_editor_plugin.cpp
index 0213dbd..7f045e9 100644
--- a/tools/editor/plugins/canvas_item_editor_plugin.cpp
+++ b/tools/editor/plugins/canvas_item_editor_plugin.cpp
@@ -1492,7 +1492,7 @@ void CanvasItemEditor::_viewport_input_event(const InputEvent& p_event) {
        while ((n && n != scene && n->get_owner() != scene) || (n && !n->is_type("CanvasItem"))) {
            n = n->get_parent();
        };
-       c = n->cast_to<CanvasItem>();
+       c = n ? n->cast_to<CanvasItem>() : 0;
 #if 0
        if ( b.pressed ) box_selection_start( click );
 #endif
```

The alternative is to check whether `this` isn't `NULL` before calling the `dynamic_cast` inside `Object::cast_to<>()` method.

Maybe some other crashes caused by GCC 6 are also related to this?

data.title: Make it possible to inspect and preview the whole scene while the game is running
data.body:
As discussed briefly on IRC by @reduz, @eska014 and me:

**<bojidar_bg>** reduz: also, another question, are there plans to allow developers to see the full scene tree and preview of a running (though maybe paused) game through the editor?
**<eska>** bojidar_bg, you can already see the scene tree in debuffer->info
**<eska>** debugger I mean
**<bojidar_bg>** it is terrifying to go through the debugger
**<eska>** bojidar_bg, it's just a tab, click the reload button once and you get the whole tree
**<bojidar_bg>** eska: does it allow for property value observance?
**<eska>** no
**<bojidar_bg>** well, that's one thing, the other is running editor plugins on it
**<bojidar_bg>** and looking outside the reaches of the camera..
**<reduz>** bojidar_bg, it should allow that
**<reduz>** never made it, but i guess it should be done
**<bojidar_bg>** reduz: would you like an issue about it?
**<reduz>** sure
**<reduz>** I was thinking of moving that to the backtrace debug screen, so besides properties you can see the tree and properties of nodes/resources
**<bojidar_bg>** reduz: I think that putting it into the debugger will make it harder to see, and I would personally prefer to run it fullscreen as a tab
**<reduz>** fullscreen?
**<bojidar_bg>** reduz: as if it was another scene

data.title: forum registration : waiting for admin approval after 2 captcha is slightly too much
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
http://godotdevelopers.org

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):

Since identifiers from the ancient forum have not been migrated to this new one, I had to register again.

I understand that bots and spammers are plaguing the net, but i find that having to wait for admin approval after filling 2 captcha is slightly too much :-/

I only wanted to post some screenshots and share my enthusiasm. And now i'm all frustrated :-(((( 

**Steps to reproduce:**
- goto godotdevelopers.org and click on register
- dig your brain to find a username that please you
- invent a password that is both hard to guess and easy to remember
- select which of your email address you want to expose
- fill a first captch to prove you're not a bot
- once you proved you're not a bot, fill a second captcha to prove you're still not a bot
- validate
- goto your email-box and wait for the confirmation mail
- discover the confirmation mail is not a "click to confirm" mail but just a notification that you'll have to wait for admin approval
- go back to the forum and login
- discover you can't login till it is approved by admin
- goto IRC and complain about how frustrated you are
- goto bed and sleep
- come back to the forum the next afternoon
- discover you are still waiting for admin approval
- discover your enthusiasm is changed into frustration 

**Link to minimal example project** (optional but very welcome):

data.title: Editor is not updating properly when it's not maximized
data.body:
Ubuntu Gnome / Linux ~ Godot 2.0.1 / 2.0.2 / 2.0.3 and build from source (I have tested it on all).

When the editor is not maximized changes made in the editor while running the project won't be display after a while, which is very inconvenient when using the output (for printing stuff), pressing a tab to switch to another scene won't happen after a few seconds (even with the option "update always"). There is not problem when the project it's not running.

EDIT:
Processor: Intel Core2 Duo CPU P8400 @ 2.26GHz  2 
Graphics: Mobile Intel GM45 Express Chipset
Memory: 3.8 GiB
Base Sytem: Ubuntu 15.10 64-bit

data.title: Auto-save does not save all edited scenes
data.body: I was going to submit this as a feature request but it seems to me this behaviour is not as desired. Currently when I run my project with F5/run button, and I have "Auto save before running" checked, only the current scene is saved. Others that are currently 'dirty' remain that way. This is doubly annoying as there is currently no way to 'save all scenes' (unless I'm missing something).

data.title: Find node in project browser
data.body:
I'd love to have a feature where you could locate a given node from the 2D view, in the project/node tree. Sometimes a node is buried down several levels, or is otherwise time consuming to locate.

Currently a selected node is highlighted in the browser if it's already in view (in the tree) but not if it isn't. So the idea is to expand whichever nodes are necessary in the tree, and scroll the selected node into view.

Normally this would be implemented as a right-click in the 2D view, bringing up a context menu "Find in Project Window" or similar, so I'm not sure where this could fit into the current schedule.

(I haven't done any 3D stuff but I guess it would apply there as well)

data.title: Inconsistent result using draw_line() ?
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Windows 8.1 x64, Godot 2.0.3

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
I was trying to make a square border selection effect using draw_line method.
I get mostly correct result, except lower-left corner doesn't get painted for some reason:
![godot_draw_line_bug_x4](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5756107/15276805/3b130de2-1afb-11e6-9217-dfebf233bd5b.png)

**Steps to reproduce:**
1. start project, add root node, create new script.
2. add following commands to a _draw() call of the script:
draw_line( Vector2( 10, 10 ), Vector2( 20, 10 ), Color( 1.0, 0.0, 0.0 ) )
draw_line( Vector2( 10, 20 ), Vector2( 20, 20 ), Color( 1.0, 0.0, 0.0 ) )
draw_line( Vector2( 10, 10 ), Vector2( 10, 20 ), Color( 1.0, 0.0, 0.0 ) )
draw_line( Vector2( 20, 10 ), Vector2( 20, 20 ), Color( 1.0, 0.0, 0.0 ) )

**Link to minimal example project** (optional but very welcome):

data.title: exported var of type Image are not auto-updated
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
official 2.0.3stable win64

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):

Can't say wether it is a bug or a feature request.

When, into a script, you export a variable of type Image(), you can use the inspector to load an image.

If you modify this image file outside of the editor, the editor does not automatically update it like are usually auto-updated other external ressources like textures etc.

And if you press the little "refresh" button at the left of the script variable into the inspector, it clears the image isntead of reloading it.

Then you have to reload the image manually.

**Steps to reproduce:**
- create a script with an `export var image = Image()` (see example below)
- attach an white image to the script variable using the inspector
- edit the image using an external image editor, change the color of the pixel(0,0) and save your modification to the same file
- go back to the editor and run again (the result is be the same)
- click the little "refresh" button at the right of the script variable into the inspector (the image is cleared instead of reloaded)
- reload manually the picture and run again the script.

**Link to minimal example project** (optional but very welcome):

```
extends Node

export var my_image = Image()

func _ready():
    print( my_image.get_pixel(0,0) )
```

When you're in the root folder (res://) at the FileSystem dock, double mouse click on any file or folder doesn't work (pressing "Enter" key works properly).

data.title: Scaling CollisionShape2D in CollisionBody2D hangs up the editor
data.body:
Win10 64bit, tested with Godot 2.0.3 and 2.0.2

Scaling big CollisionShape2D's (or setting big shape sizes) hangs up the editor.
Tested with CircleShape2D and RectangleShape2D.

**Steps to reproduce:**
1. Make a new scene, add a RigidBody2D as the root
2. Add a CollisionShape2D as a child, set it to a CircleShape2D
3. Set the shape radius to max (input 99999 it will be clamped)
4. Press enter to apply the new shape radius, a small lag might occur
5. Set CollisionShape2D scale to 5,5
6. Editor hangs up

Notes:
- All CollisionBody2D's do this (Rigid/Kinematic/Static) + Area2D
- CollisionShape2D without a CollisionBody2D does not hang up the editor
- RectangleShape does not clamp values, so the hangup may occur before scaling the CollisionShape2D

While obviously such sizes should be avoided, the sole ability to crash the editor should be contained.

data.title: Game closes when reloading scene while using yields
data.body:
Ubuntu Gnome / Linux - Build from source  ([last commint](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/commit/7913e792acd656469b29fb90be1dbb7c06a855ba)).

I have this piece of code running:
![screenshot from 2016-05-14 19-24-04](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6760623/15271151/7c1ced1e-1a09-11e6-8542-422a7190da3b.png)

And if I try to reload the current scene (`get_tree().reload_current_scene()`) the game closes without dropping any errors.

I also try with `get_tree().call_deferred("reload_current_scene")`, no luck either.

**sample project is in this comment: https://github.com/godotengine/godot/issues/4658#issuecomment-219407248**

EDIT:
It does the same with the yield waiting for idle_frame.
